title: Binary Tree Patterns Quiz
description: Test traversal choice, recursion contracts, and tree complexity.

questions.question: In recursive tree problems, the most critical first step is:
questions.explanation: A clear return contract keeps combination logic correct.

questions.question: Level-order traversal is naturally implemented with:
questions.explanation: FIFO queue expands nodes depth by depth.

questions.question: For max depth recurrence, which relation is correct?
questions.explanation: Depth is one plus deeper subtree depth.

questions.question: If root is null, many DFS tree functions should return:
options: A base value such as 0 or false
questions.explanation: Null base case anchors recursion and prevents crashes.

questions.question: DFS recursion extra space is usually:
options: O(h) where h is tree height
questions.explanation: Call stack depth follows tree height in DFS recursion.

questions.question: A common tree bug is:
options: Mixing local return value with global aggregate intent
questions.explanation: Confusing the recursion contract with global tracking breaks logic.
